private_information: You can move only disks: A, B, C, D, E.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk of any peg can be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to achieve the goal configuration while moving only your permitted disks.

private_information: You can move only disks: F, G, H, I, J.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk of any peg can be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to achieve the goal configuration while moving only your permitted disks.

private_information: You can move only disks: K, L, M, N, O.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk of any peg can be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Cooperate to achieve the goal configuration while moving only your permitted disks.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the move list.
You verify adherence to Tower of Hanoi rules, agent disk-permission constraints, and state progression from initial to goal without shortcuts or out-of-order effects.
Reject quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any bookkeeping shortcuts; only physics-consistent, stepwise-valid moves are acceptable.
auditor.goal: Validate the full move sequence for legality and consistency and emit an audited plan.

private_information: You coordinate all agents and compile the final planning artifacts.

You must produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver, using multi-peg Tower of Hanoi modeling with typed objects, clear/on/smaller predicates, and goals matching the specified target configuration.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the audited plan with the environment model and emit the final PDDL domain and problem.

private_information: You assemble and publish the ordered list of primitive moves in the required format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.
Use the provided environment constraints and target goal; do not violate Tower of Hanoi rules.
plan_writer.goal: Provide a correct, executable ordered move list that achieves the goal configuration.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Tower of Hanoi rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only a top disk may be moved; no larger disk may ever be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent capabilities: agent_1 may move disks {A,B,C,D,E}; agent_2 may move disks {F,G,H,I,J}; agent_3 may move disks {K,L,M,N,O}.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A,C,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg has (top→bottom) B,D; right peg is empty.
ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk C from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left

moves.system_prompt: You consolidate the official ordered list of primitive moves for this Tower of Hanoi instance; emit the moves exactly in the required format.
moves.prompt: Produce the ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal configuration, respecting agent disk permissions and Tower of Hanoi rules; use the environment ordered_moves and do not invent additional steps.

confirm_moves_subset.system_prompt: Filter and confirm only those moves involving disks A,B,C,D,E and verify each is legal given the Tower of Hanoi constraints.
confirm_moves_subset.prompt: From the full move list, extract the subsequence executed by agent_1 and confirm legality step-by-step without altering order.

confirm_moves_subset.system_prompt: Filter and confirm only those moves involving disks F,G,H,I,J and verify Tower of Hanoi legality; if none, return an empty validated list.
confirm_moves_subset.prompt: From the full move list, extract the subsequence executed by agent_2 and confirm legality step-by-step without altering order.

confirm_moves_subset.system_prompt: Filter and confirm only those moves involving disks K,L,M,N,O and verify Tower of Hanoi legality; if none, return an empty validated list.
confirm_moves_subset.prompt: From the full move list, extract the subsequence executed by agent_3 and confirm legality step-by-step without altering order.

audit_plan.system_prompt: Audit temporal and causal consistency of the entire move list; verify only top disks are moved, no larger on smaller, agent-disk permissions respected, and final state matches the goal; remove any bookkeeping shortcuts.
audit_plan.prompt: Validate the full ordered move list against the initial and goal configurations and emit the audited move list if and only if every step is legal and sufficient.

pddl.system_prompt: Integrate the audited plan with the environment model and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver; include <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem> blocks; keep actions generic (move-to-peg and move-to-disk) with typed objects and predicates on, clear, smaller.
pddl.prompt: Using the audited move list, the peg and disk sets, and the specified goal configuration, emit a PDDL domain and problem for a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks such that the unique goal encodes: left peg has (top→bottom) A,C,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg has (top→bottom) B,D; right peg is empty; ensure objects are typed (place, disk, peg), predicates include on, clear, smaller, and the initial state matches the provided initial configuration; target FastDownward defaults.
